# ARKitSession

**Class**

The main entry point for receiving data from ARKit.

## Declaration

```swift
final class ARKitSession
```

## Overview

Sessions in ARKit require either implicit or explicit authorization. To explicitly ask for permission for a particular kind of data and choose when a person is prompted for that permission, call [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARKitSession/requestAuthorization(for:)] before [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARKitSession/run(_:)].

The following shows a session that starts by requesting implicit authorization to use world sensing:

```swift
let planeData = PlaneDetectionProvider(alignments: [.horizontal, .vertical])

Task {
    do {
        try await self.session.run([planeData])
        // Update app based on the planeData.anchorUpdates async sequence.
    } catch {
        print("ARKitSession error:", error)
    }
}
```

Because a [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/PlaneDetectionProvider] instance’s required authorizations include [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARKitSession/AuthorizationType/worldSensing], the system asks someone using your app to permit world sensing before ARKit supplies any of that kind of data.



## Starting and stopping a session

- **init()**: Creates a new session.
- **run(_:)**: Runs a session with the data providers you supply.
- **stop()**: Stops all data providers running in this session.
- **ARKitSession.Error**: An error that might occur when running data providers on an ARKit session.

## Getting authorization

- **requestAuthorization(for:)**: Requests authorization from the user to use the specified kinds of ARKit data.
- **ARKitSession.AuthorizationType**: The authorization types you can request from ARKit.
- **queryAuthorization(for:)**: Checks whether the current session is authorized for particular authorization types without requesting authorization.
- **ARKitSession.AuthorizationStatus**: The authorization states for a type of ARKit data.

## Observing a session

- **events**: An asynchronous sequence of events that provide updates to the current authorization status of the session.
- **ARKitSession.Events**: A sequence of events.
- **ARKitSession.Event**: Enumeration of possible session events.
- **description**: A textual representation of this session.

## Initializers

- **init(device:)**: Create a new session connected to the specified device.

## Instance Properties

- **dataProviders**: A list of all data providers on this session.

## visionOS

- **Setting up access to ARKit data**: Check whether your app can use ARKit and respect people’s privacy.
- **DataProvider**: A source of live data from ARKit.
- **Anchor**: The identity, location, and orientation of an object in world space.
- **ARKit in visionOS**: Create immersive augmented reality experiences.

## Conforms To

- CustomStringConvertible
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
